conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway isometric-style render with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, perceptible room volumes, and the ceiling/roof removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and clean corner geometry; cutaway is clean and interior is visible. Minor simplification in some wall/opening details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and general adjacency (kitchen-left, dining/top-right area, living-right, stairs-left, bathroom-central) are mostly preserved, but there are notable proportional/dimension inconsistencies (e.g., living room dimension text differs from 2D plan) and some boundary sizing/placement appears altered.

interior_elements.notes: Key elements included: kitchen counters/stove, dining table, sofa, bathroom fixtures, stairs. Placement is generally in correct rooms with mostly reasonable scale/orientation.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear with good visibility and minimal artifacts. Text labels/dimension text remain on the 3D floor, reducing presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Relative proportions/dimensions are not fully faithful to the 2D plan (notably the living room dimension labeling and perceived room sizing shifts).
Doors/windows do not appear to match the 2D plan exactly in count/placement/orientation (door swings not represented; some opening positions simplified).
Text labels/dimension annotations are present in the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with clear volume and structure, but with noticeable layout/proportion and opening-detail mismatches versus the 2D plan.
